featured.text: The donkey was so much weighed down by the wet sand that he could hardly get out of the stream.
I could hardly believe my eyes.
He hardly ever wears a necktie.

other.text: The boys were thrilled, for they could hardly believe that they were being paid to do something they 33 !
You could hardly even look up without getting something in your eye."
The astronauts can hardly breathe in a space suit.

definition.en_def: Barely or scarcely; not very much.
definition.example: She could hardly hear the music over the noise.
